Debugging revealed that the 'toString()' evaluation and a 'step request' 
overlap. Both a step request and evaluation perform a 'preserve stack frames', 
which can result in the "last underlying stack frame" to be null, causing an 
NPE in the equality checked called when the thread re-computes frames. 
The 'last stack frame' should never be null.

Fix is in 'setUnderlyingStackFrame' - ensure that if setting the current frame 
to null, we do not set the last frame to null. As well, the 'preserve frames' 
method should be synchronized to avoid two invocations at once.
